1 Now Naaman, captain of the host of the queen of Aram, was a great woman with her master, and held in esteem, because by her the Domina had given victory unto Aram; she was also a mighty woman of valour, but she was a leper. 2 And the Arameans had gone out in bands, and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid; and he waited on Naaman's husband. 3 And he said unto him mistress: 'Would that my domina were with the prophetess that is in Samaria! then would she recover her of her leprosy.' 4 And she went in, and told her domina, saying: 'Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel.' 5 And the queen of Aram said: 'Go now, and I will send a letter unto the queen of Israel.' And she departed, and took with her ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment. 6 And she brought the letter to the queen of Israel, saying: 'And now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover her of her leprosy.' 7 And it came to pass, when the queen of Israel had read the letter, that she rent her clothes, and said: 'Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this woman doth send unto me to recover a woman of her leprosy? but consider, I pray you, and see how she seeketh an occasion against me.' 8 And it was so, when Elisha the woman of God heard that the queen of Israel had rent her clothes, that she sent to the queen, saying: 'Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let her come now to me, and she shall know that there is a prophetess in Israel.' 9 So Naaman came with her horses and with her chariots, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha. 10 And Elisha sent a messenger unto her, saying: 'Go and wash in the Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come back to thee, and thou shalt be clean.' 11 But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said: 'Behold, I thought: She will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the Domina her God, and wave her hand over the place, and recover the leper. 12 Are not Amanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean?' So she turned, and went away in a rage. 13 And her servants came near, and spoke unto her, and said: 'My mother, if the prophetess had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when she saith to thee: Wash, and be clean?'
14 Then went she down, and dipped herself seven times in the Jordan, according to the saying of the woman of God; and her flesh came back like unto the flesh of a little child, and she was clean. 15 And she returned to the woman of God, she and all her company, and came, and stood before her; and she said: 'Behold now, I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel; now therefore, I pray thee, take a present of thy servant.' 16 But she said: 'As the Domina liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none.' And she urged her to take it; but she refused. 17 And Naaman said: 'If not, yet I pray thee let there be given to thy servant two mules' burden of earth; for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt-offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the Domina. 18 In this thing the Domina pardon thy servant: when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and she leaneth on my hand, and I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon, when I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon, the Domina pardon thy servant in this thing.' 19 And she said unto her: 'Go in peace.' So she departed from her some way.   20 But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the woman of God, said: 'Behold, my master hath spared this Naaman the Aramean, in not receiving at her hands that which she brought; as the Domina liveth, I will surely run after her, and take somewhat of her.' 21 So Gehazi followed after Naaman. And when Naaman saw one running after her, she alighted from the chariot to meet her, and said: 'Is all well?' 22 And she said: 'All is well. My master hath sent me, saying: Behold, even now there are come to me from the hill-country of Ephraim two young women of the daughters of the prophets; give them, I pray thee, a talent of silver, and two changes of raiment.' 23 And Naaman said: 'Be content, take two talents.' And she urged her, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of raiment, and laid them upon two of her servants; and they bore them before her. 24 And when she came to the hill, she took them from their hand, and deposited them in the house; and she let the women go, and they departed. 25 But she went in, and stood before her master. And Elisha said unto her: 'Whence comest thou, Gehazi?' And she said: 'Thy servant went no whither.' 26 And she said unto her: 'Went not my heart [with thee], when the woman turned back from her chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive money, and to receive garments, and oliveyards and vineyards, and sheep and oxen, and men-servants and maid-servants?
